newsitem.title: USA: Sulcus Computer names CEO, acting chairman.
newsitem.headline: Sulcus Computer names CEO, acting chairman.

text.p: Sulcus Computer Corp said Friday it has named Leon Harris chief executive officer and Robert Gries acting chairman.
Harris, who joined the board of directors in November, 1996, will continue as a member of the board. Both he and Gries will assume their new duties immediately.
Most recently, Harris was chairman and chief executive of Physalia Corp, a company he founded in 1994 to gather, organize, and apply diverse expertise in the computer systems/technology market.

The company said that Gries, who has been a director of Sulcus since 1983, will serve as acting chairman until a permanent chairman is appointed. The former chairman, Jeffrey Ratner, resigned last month. Ratner remains a director.
Gries is president of the Gries Cos and has been engaged in venture capital financing.
It was not immediately known who Harris was replacing as chief executive.

Last May, the Securities and Exchange Commission sanctioned the company and two former executives, including Ratner, for allegedly using improper accounting methods and issuing false financial statements.

Ratner and former Chief Financial Officer John Picardi, without admitting or denying the SEC's allegations, agreed to a "cease and desist" order requiring them not to violate those regulations in the future.
In addition, Picardi, who is a certified public accountant, was barred from appearing or practicing before the SEC for 1-1/2 years.
In an administrative proceeding, the SEC alleged that Sulcus used improper accounting in connection with the acquisitions of four unprofitable domestic and foreign corporations in 1991 and 1992.
As a result, it filed false financial statements for those years, the SEC alleged.
Ratner gave up his chief executive title in September 1995, but remained chairman until his resignation from that post last month, said William McLay, managing director of the company.
